metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2308 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in vDPA with VDUSE backend. There are currently no checks in VDUSE kernel driver to ensure the size of the device config space is in line with the features advertised by the VDUSE userspace application. In case of a mismatch, Virtio drivers config read helpers do not initialize the memory indirectly passed to vduse_vdpa_get_config() returning uninitialized memory from the stack. This could cause undefined behavior or data leaks in Virtio drivers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> possibly need to pick up dc1db0060c02 ("vduse: check that offset is within bounds in get_config()") (v5.18) issue has likely been present since c8a6153b6c59 ("vduse: Introduce VDUSE - vDPA Device in Userspace") (v5.15)
